So

reviewText: Hilarious game! A bit like being in an episode of South Park. I never expected to kill both Hitler and the Dalai Lama before breakfast. Lots of brilliantly funny details. And I really like the human soundtrack! I don't play a lot of games but a friend recommended this one and I'm very glad they did. The low tech graphics for a parody of Call of Duty made me laugh too.
voteText: 21 of 37 people (57%) found this review helpful 8 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Product received for free

https://youtu.be/vSnw3pyhA6w
Game: NotCoD™
Genre: 2D Action Parody
Developer: NotGames
Publisher: NotGames
Copy supplied by developer

NotCoD™ is a 2D action parody game of Call of Duty developed and published by NotGames. Your enjoyment of the game purely relies on how much you find its premise funny.

STORYSet in Britain, you play as Private Suds Sudzington Jr and you find yourself dropped ♥♥♥♥-firstwards into this Hell. You will murder WWII reenactors, priests, nuns, children, and even animals.
The script is very funny, and most jokes hit right home, making fun of not only CoD, but also other games, religion, and much more without feeling disrespectful, which is something really hard to achieve.

GRAPHICSThe hand-drawn graphics are quite ugly at first, but the more you play the more you get used to them, and they are quite charming in the end. But still, they are not all that good (even though it is part of the joke).

GAMEPLAYThe game smartly uses a 2D perspective, with really smooth controls for both k/m and gamepad. You can carry two weapons at a time, 4 frag grenades, and 4 smoke grenades. A good achievment of the developers was making this a constantly enjoyable game that has good variety: gunfights, turret sections, on-rail sequences, and even puzzle keep changing the pace of your playthrough. There are many different weapons and enemies to fight, each requiring a different strategy to dispatch them as efficiently as possible.
I enjoyed playing through the game, and it felt pretty good. I can't deny, however, that in the long run it got a bit tiring, even with the different gameplay sequences.

CHALLENGEYou have a health bar, and you need to find medikits to regain health. Gunfights are mostly doable, but some sequences tend to get really hard, delivering some decent challenge.

SOUNDThe british voice acting is a joy to listen to, and the soundtrack is darn fun to listen to. Props to the composer!

REPLAYABILITYMultiple episodes will be released in the future, and when you finish the game you can play it again to find more secrets, or you can play a Zombie mode with a friend in split-screen coop. And don't forget the 73 achievements to unlock!

Overall, this is a funny and competent shooter that delivers good jokes and decent variety. Easily one of the best satire games available right now. Highly recommended on sale, and on full price for lovers of parodies.

Story: 7.5
Graphics: 6
Gameplay: 7
Challenge: 6.5
Sound: 7
Replayability: 7

ENJOYMENT: 7
FRUSTRATION: 3

This is one of the most hilarious games I have ever played. I really love the sound effects, graphics, and story. It all goes well together and is quite fitting. I have only scratched the surface of inside jokes, puns, and silly things this game has in store for the player, but I am pretty hooked.

reviewText: I've been waiting so long for this game to come out, And it sure as hell was worth the wait... though the fight against Murdoch needs to be nerfed a bit in my opinion. He has way too much health and it takes so bloody long. Overall this game is a whole lot more enjoyable, witty, original, and controversial than the COD games. I LOVE IT! 10/10

reviewText:
Product received for free

The jokes are DEFINITELY the focus of this game, for obvious reasons... but it's all British humour, and a lot of Americans don't find British humour funny at all. Given that the United States is Steam's largest demographic, this would explain why this game is getting such mixed reception. I, on the other hand, come from down under. I'm from Australia, mate.

The gameplay, while in no way innovative, is, as the trailer puts it, a proper game" this time. So if you liked NotGTAV but wished it wasn't a Snake clone
date: you'll love NotCoD.\n\nThe graphics and sound... well
recommended: for the most part they're part of the humour
hoursPlayed: so if you don't find the game funny
voteText: the art within it is not going to redeem it for you. I will note
votesHelpful: that this game has a kickass title screen theme.\n\nSo
votesTotal: should you buy this game? Not if you're one of those heretics who... ahem... not if you don't like Monty Python. Otherwise

reviewText:
This game is simply wonderful!

+ The character design and the animations look super realistic.
+ The sound and special effects are bombastic!
+ The game looks so much better than Infinite Warfare and its setting is much more interesting.
+ The Characters develop very well.
+ The story has a lot of twist and it just awesome!
+ It's the most polished game I've ever seen. It runs smoothly with constant 60fps on my potatoe.

--> NotGTAV" was already an impressive piece of art
date: but this is even better and it will probably win the "Game of the Millenium Award".\n"
